-- Possible client file formats which have to be checked
... 10 = old invoice file format (REC, GUT, END)
... 1000 = dutch FF invoice file format
... 1002 = old dutch ND debtor file format
-- Set/reset output parameters
-- Prepare variables
... extract path and file name from PI.PathFileName
-- 1, Check if it's a uploaded client file by user (possible the case when filename starts with *_*_*_)
-- 2. Extract the user who uploaded the file
... extract the user who uploaded the file
-- 3. Check file contents for allowed admins/clients
(To keep the same logic as implemented in BSP104 to read the file contents, first the file format is determined, which is
a subset of the module implemented in BSP104)
Workaround to solve problem when file is read again after check file format
... old invoice file format
... new invoice file format or stock file
... dutch invoicer file format
... old dutch invoicer file format
-- Read first 2 lines from client file, to check the file type
... empty lines can be ignored
.. remove possible first double quote, delivered sometimes in case of CSV files

ExpSyntax.val: Left (Trim ({0,2}),3)='REC' OR Left (Trim ({0,2}),3)='GUT' OR Left (Trim ({0,3}),3)='REC' OR Left (Trim ({0,3}),3)='GUT'
Left (Trim ({0,2}),2)='FF' OR Left (Trim ({0,2}),2)='DD' OR Left (Trim ({0,3}),2)='FF' OR Left (Trim ({0,3}),2)='DD'
Left (Trim ({0,2}),2)='NF' OR Left (Trim ({0,2}),2)='ND' OR Left (Trim ({0,3}),2)='NF' OR Left (Trim ({0,3}),2)='ND'
